scenarios.title: Freemium SaaS with heavy IP
scenarios.description: Small team, global customers, significant spend on patents and code. Monetization via subscriptions.
scenarios.explain: SaaS with meaningful IP and cross-border subs benefits from strong IP protection and broad treaty networks. Innovation-supporting regimes help reduce effective tax on qualifying income.

scenarios.title: Hardware prototyping & design
scenarios.description: Building physical prototypes, frequent R&D iterations, moderate EU sales.
scenarios.explain: Strong R&D incentives and access to hardware/design ecosystems support rapid iteration; manufacturing depth eases scale-up.

scenarios.title: Fintech with strong compliance
scenarios.description: Payment services, early traction, needs friendly regulator and fast incorporation.
scenarios.explain: Fintech-friendly environments with efficient incorporation and solid treaty networks help reduce friction on cross-border flows.

scenarios.title: Indie gaming studio
scenarios.description: Digital downloads, IP creation, variable revenue, small distributed team.
scenarios.explain: Startup-friendly setups and IP-oriented regimes can improve overall efficiency for digital studios.

scenarios.title: EU marketplace with logistics
scenarios.description: Multi-country sellers, warehousing, VAT OSS considerations.
scenarios.explain: Logistics hubs and strong treaty networks help with cross-border complexity; OSS awareness is key.

scenarios.title: Biotech with labs
scenarios.description: Heavy R&D, grants, long runway before revenue.
scenarios.explain: Generous R&D incentives and deep talent pools are pivotal for long pre-revenue cycles.

scenarios.title: Creator economy tools (SME)
scenarios.description: Small team, steady profits, subscription revenue.
scenarios.explain: SME-oriented regimes and English-language operations reduce friction for small profitable SaaS.

scenarios.title: IP holding & licensing
scenarios.description: Group needs to hold IP and license to subsidiaries.
scenarios.explain: Holding-friendly jurisdictions with IP incentives and broad treaty networks often optimize group licensing flows.

scenarios.title: Cross-border e-commerce
scenarios.description: Warehousing in EU, OSS/IOSS questions, returns complexity.
scenarios.explain: Logistics and OSS awareness matter to keep compliance manageable at scale.

scenarios.title: DeepTech AI startup
scenarios.description: High research spend, academic partnerships, export licensing considerations.
scenarios.explain: Deep talent pools and R&D support reduce cost of innovation.

scenarios.title: Fully remote SME
scenarios.description: Distributed team across EU, modest profits, contractors.
scenarios.explain: Friendly admin for remote setups helps SMEs stay compliant.

scenarios.title: Media subscriptions
scenarios.description: Content IP, recurring subscriptions, cross-border royalties.
scenarios.explain: IP-favoring regimes and treaty breadth help with royalties and licensing.

scenarios.title: Manufacturing for EU export
scenarios.description: Physical products, supply chain complexity, cross-border VAT.
scenarios.explain: Manufacturing expertise, logistics infrastructure, and treaty networks support complex supply chains.

scenarios.title: Professional services consulting
scenarios.description: High-value consulting, cross-border clients, personal service delivery.
scenarios.explain: Strong treaty networks and professional service frameworks facilitate cross-border consulting.

scenarios.title: Fashion e-commerce brand
scenarios.description: Design-focused brand, EU-wide sales, seasonal inventory.
scenarios.explain: Design ecosystems and logistics infrastructure support fashion brands with complex supply chains.
